did.unittitle: John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale
did.abstract: Bill of sale for Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825. John Ditmars was commander of the Third Regiment of the New York State Militia from 1811 to 1814.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John Ditmars and Jacob Duryee enslaved woman bill of sale, 1977.583, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Ditmars was commander of the Third Regiment of the New York State Militia from 1811 to 1814.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bill of sale for transfer of Sine (b. 1817), an enslaved African American woman, from John Ditmars of the town of Flatlands, Kings County, to Jacob Duryee of the town of Flatbush. The bill is dated June 16, 1825.
